141B: Lesson 6

Matplotlib

A plot!

So we have all seen plotting in R, matlab, excel, etc. Matplotlib is the premier python package, created by the late John Hunter, The dataframe is a data type that acts like a table (think of excel tables). The idea is that there are fields (or columns) and then there are different records that have those fields. Think of individuals that have attributes and then a dataset of many such individuals. Matlab is built around the matrix type, for which we use numpy. R is built around the dataframe type, and for this we have pandas. There are several advantages that pandas gives us that we cannot get from numpy and the array type. You should read the more complete list here, but here are what I the main advantages to pandas.
  • Great I/O (input/output), for reading files of different extensions, reading from sql database systems, and writing the dataframes
  • Fancy slicing and subsetting
  • SQl-like features such as grouping, indexing, and joining.
  • Nice handling of missingness
Missing data, Indexing and slicing, Miscellaneous Pandas functionality
Matrix operations
